home.welcome-subtitle: Where we help you with waste management and make world a better place
home.mission-content: Our mission is to empower international students at the University of Washington with practical waste management knowledge. We strive to create awareness and provide resources that encourage students to classify waste properly. Through education and engagement, we aim to foster a community of environmentally conscious individuals who contribute to sustainable practices and make a positive impact on our campus and beyond.

know.title: What we should know
know.thing1: Rapid Increase in Material Production and Waste:
know.detail1: As the global population and economy grow, the production of materials like plastics, paper, and aluminum has significantly increased. Without proper waste management, this leads to a considerable rise in mismanaged waste, polluting ecosystems like rivers, lakes, and the ocean.
know.detail2: An estimated 75 to 199 million tons of plastic waste currently reside in our oceans, with an additional 33 billion pounds of plastic entering the marine environment annually. This overwhelming amount of plastic, which includes the vast Great Pacific Garbage Patch, is too much for the existing waste management and recycling infrastructure to handle.
know.detail3: Since its inception in the early 20th century, plastic production has skyrocketed, from 2 million tonnes per year in 1950 to 460 million metric tons in 2019. A total of 9.5 billion metric tons of plastic were produced from 1950 to 2019, with about 7 billion metric tons becoming waste, half of which are single-use products.
know.detail4: It is estimated that over 1 million marine animals, including sea turtles, die each year due to plastic pollution in the ocean. The majority of the victims are seabirds, with marine mammals also significantly affected but less visible in media reports.

learn.content: According to UW disposal guiline, there are three main types of waste:
learn.video-desc: Let's see how different waste are categorized and processed after we dispose them.

do.title: What we should do
do.detail1: Learn the urgent situation of global environmental health and the garbage disposal guideline of King County.
do.detail2: Categorize the garbage before desposing and dispose the garbage into the correct bin with the help of Waste Bank.
do.detail3: Join us to do community activity focused on environmental initiatives to contribute to the world around us.
